trans-unit.source: !Note This page requires a basic understanding of graphics pipelines.
trans-unit.target: !Note This page requires a basic understanding of graphics pipelines.

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor organizes how scenes are rendered. You can use it to customize almost every part of the rendering pipeline. For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor organizes how scenes are rendered. You can use it to customize almost every part of the rendering pipeline. For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: render to one or more render textures, with different viewports
trans-unit.target: render to one or more render textures, with different viewports

trans-unit.source: apply post effects to a render target, selected before or after rendering a camera
trans-unit.target: apply post effects to a render target, selected before or after rendering a camera

trans-unit.source: clear a render target or clear only the depth buffer (eg to always render on top of a render target in a FPS game, or render the UI)
trans-unit.target: clear a render target or clear only the depth buffer (eg to always render on top of a render target in a FPS game, or render the UI)

trans-unit.source: modify the compositor from scripts (or any animation system), for example to modify post effects
trans-unit.target: modify the compositor from scripts (or any animation system), for example to modify post effects

trans-unit.source: Stride includes a graphics compositor when you create a project.
trans-unit.target: Stride includes a graphics compositor when you create a project.

trans-unit.source: If you need to create another graphics compositor, in the Asset View, click Add asset and select Misc > Graphics compositor.
trans-unit.target: If you need to create another graphics compositor, in the Asset View, click Add asset and select Misc > Graphics compositor.

trans-unit.source: You can choose one of two presets:
trans-unit.target: You can choose one of two presets:

trans-unit.source: You can have multiple graphics compositors in your project, but you can only use one compositor at a time. At runtime, Stride uses the graphics compositor you specify in Game Settings.
trans-unit.target: You can have multiple graphics compositors in your project, but you can only use one compositor at a time. At runtime, Stride uses the graphics compositor you specify in Game Settings.

trans-unit.source: You can also change the graphics compositor at runtime in a script.
trans-unit.target: You can also change the graphics compositor at runtime in a script.

trans-unit.source: You customize the graphics compositor in the graphics compositor editor.
trans-unit.target: You customize the graphics compositor in the graphics compositor editor.

trans-unit.source: !Note The graphics compositor editor is an experimental feature.
trans-unit.target: !Note The graphics compositor editor is an experimental feature.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor editor is divided into nodes. You can set the properties of each node in the Property Grid on the right.
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor editor is divided into nodes. You can set the properties of each node in the Property Grid on the right.

trans-unit.source: In the Entry Points node, you configure the pipeline for each entry point.
trans-unit.target: In the Entry Points node, you configure the pipeline for each entry point.

trans-unit.source: Editor, to render the Game Studio editor
trans-unit.target: Editor, to render the Game Studio editor

trans-unit.source: Single view (referred to as Utility in the Property Grid), to render other things, such as light probes and cubemaps
trans-unit.target: Single view (referred to as Utility in the Property Grid), to render other things, such as light probes and cubemaps

trans-unit.source: Each entry point can use a separate rendering pipeline. For example, the game and editor might share the same forward renderer and post-processing effects while your single view uses a separate forward renderer.
trans-unit.target: Each entry point can use a separate rendering pipeline. For example, the game and editor might share the same forward renderer and post-processing effects while your single view uses a separate forward renderer.

trans-unit.source: Connect an entry point to a renderer
trans-unit.target: Connect an entry point to a renderer

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, next to the entry point you want to connect (Editor, Game or Utility), select the renderer you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, next to the entry point you want to connect (Editor, Game or Utility), select the renderer you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: For information about the different renderers, see Scene renderers.
trans-unit.target: For information about the different renderers, see Scene renderers.

trans-unit.source: In a typical setup, the forward renderer renders almost everything in your scene. It renders, in order:
trans-unit.target: In a typical setup, the forward renderer renders almost everything in your scene. It renders, in order:

trans-unit.source: The forward renderer is also where you set virtual reality options. You configure the forward renderer properties in the forward entry node.
trans-unit.target: The forward renderer is also where you set virtual reality options. You configure the forward renderer properties in the forward entry node.

trans-unit.source: The debug renderer is used by scripts to print debug information. For more information, see Debug renderers.
trans-unit.target: The debug renderer is used by scripts to print debug information. For more information, see Debug renderers.

trans-unit.source: The post-processing effects node comes after the forward renderer and controls the post effects in your game. For more information, see post-processing effects.
trans-unit.target: The post-processing effects node comes after the forward renderer and controls the post effects in your game. For more information, see post-processing effects.

trans-unit.source: To create a node, right-click the graphics compositor editor and select the type of node you want to create:
trans-unit.target: To create a node, right-click the graphics compositor editor and select the type of node you want to create:
